stem: Peripheral neuropathy from vasculitis causes a posterior interosseous nerve palsy. Which movement is primarily lost?

choices.A: Finger extension at the metacarpophalangeal joints

rationale_correct: PIN denervates most wrist/finger extensors; MCP extension is characteristically weak with PIN palsy.

rationale_distractors.C: Elbow flexion is musculocutaneous (biceps/brachialis) and radial (brachioradialis).
rationale_distractors.D: Thumb opposition is median (recurrent motor to thenar).
